source: Nocedal, J. and Wright, S. J. (2006). Numerical Optimization (2nd ed.). Springer.
description: Equations 7.16-7.18 define the vector pair updates (s_i, y_i) that are stored in L-BFGS. These pairs represent the step and gradient difference vectors used in the compact representation of the Hessian approximation.
context: These formulas define the compact representation used by L-BFGS. Instead of storing a full d×d Hessian approximation, L-BFGS stores only m pairs of (s_i, y_i) vectors. Each vector has dimension d, so the total storage is O(md) instead of O(d²).
